byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon; Helene Cooper from Washington; and Mark Landler from New York.

abstract: Obama administration, in major policy shift, considers proposed military plan to arm Syrian Kurdish fighters in order to accelerate fight against Islamic State, despite political tensions move might engender with Turkey.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The major policy shift could speed up the offensive against the Islamic State but also sharply escalate tensions between Turkey and the United States.
snippet: The major policy shift could speed up the offensive against the Islamic State but also sharply escalate tensions between Turkey and the United States....

headline.main: Obama Administration Considers Arming Syrian Kurds Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: White House Considers Arming Kurds in Syria
